content.title: So what exactly is Bitcoin?
content.text:
Bitcoin is digital money. 

It can be transferred instantly and securely between any two people in the world ‚Äî without the need for a bank or any other financial company in the middle.

content.title: I just earned a ‚ÄúSat" ‚Äî what is that?
content.text:
One ‚ÄúSat‚Äù is the smallest unit of a bitcoin. 

We all know that one US Dollar can be divided into 100 cents. Similarly, one Bitcoin can be divided into 100,000,000 sats. 

In fact, you do not need to own one whole bitcoin in order to use it. You can use bitcoin whether you have 20 sats, 3000 sats ‚Äî or 100,000,000 sats (which you now know is equal to one bitcoin).
feedback: Correct. You just earned another two sats!!
Maybe‚Ä¶ but that is not the correct answer in this context üôÇ

content.title: Where do the bitcoins exist?
content.text:
Bitcoin is a new form of money. It can be used by anyone, anytime ‚Äî anywhere in the world. 

It is not tied to a specific government or region (like US Dollars). There are also no paper bills, metal coins or plastic cards. 

Everything is 100% digital. Bitcoin is a network of computers running on the internet. 

Your bitcoin is easily managed with software on your smartphone or computer!
feedback: Correct. You just earned another 5 sats.
Incorrect. Well‚Ä¶ at least not yet ;)

content.title: Who controls Bitcoin?
content.text:
Bitcoin is not controlled by any person, company or government. 

It is run by the community of users ‚Äî people and companies all around the world -- voluntarily running bitcoin software on their computers and smartphones.
answers: A voluntary community of users around the world
feedback: That is right. Bitcoin is made possible by people all around the world running bitcoin software on their computers and smartphones.
An amusing thought ‚Äî but not correct!
Wrong. There is no company nor government that controls Bitcoin.

content.title: If Bitcoin is digital money, can‚Äôt someone just copy it ‚Äî and create free money?
content.text:
The value of a bitcoin can never be copied. This is the very reason why Bitcoin is such a powerful new invention !!

Most digital files ‚Äî such as an iPhone photo, an MP3 song, or a Microsoft Word document ‚Äî can easily be duplicated and shared. 

The Bitcoin software uniquely prevents the duplication ‚Äî or ‚Äúdouble spending‚Äù ‚Äî of digital money. We will share exactly how this works later on !
answers: No ‚Äî it is impossible to copy or duplicate the value of bitcoin
Yes, you can copy bitcoins just as easily as copying a digital photo
Yes, but copying bitcoin requires very specialized computers
feedback: You know that it is not true. Try again.
Incorrect. There is no way for anyone to copy, or create a duplicate, of bitcoin
